articles.author: Sam Nussey
articles.description: SoftBank Group Corp (9984.T) said it would receive shares in telco T-Mobile US (TMUS.O) worth some $7.59 billion at no additional cost, driving the Japanese conglomerate's shares up 5%.
articles.title: SoftBank gets $7.6 bln T-Mobile stake windfall, shares soar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's foreign ministry said it had sanctioned Kharon, a U.S. firm founded by former Treasury Department officials that provides data to companies on alleged forced labour in the Xinjiang region to help them comply with U.S. laws.
articles.title: China sanctions US firm Kharon, provider of research on Xinjiang

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Half of Russia's oil and petroleum exports in 2023 will have gone to China while India's share has risen in two years to 40%, Russia's state news agencies cited Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak as saying in remarks published on Wednesday.
articles.title: Half of Russia's 2023 oil and petroleum exports went to China - Russia's Novak

articles.author: Liz Lee
articles.description: Two cities in northwestern China, Xian and Yinchuan, advised residents to stay indoors, limited heavy industrial production and halted coal processing, warning of heavy pollution over the coming days with thick fog expected.
articles.title: Northwest China cities halt heavy industries to curb pollution

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Toyota Motor's (7203.T) global production jumped 11% in November to a record level, bouncing back from last year's supply chain disruptions and benefiting from robust demand both in Japan and overseas.
articles.title: Toyota's global output surges to record in November on strong demand

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of workers in Indonesia's nickel industry staged a peaceful rally on Wednesday to demand better standards of work safety, just three days after a fire killed 18, labour groups said, vowing to strike if their demands were not met.
articles.title: Hundreds of Indonesian nickel workers rally to press safety demand

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD (002594.SZ), said on Wednesday it has obtained a conditional testing license for level 3 (L3) autonomous driving on high-speed roads.
articles.title: BYD has obtained conditional testing license for level 3 autonomous driving on high-speed roads

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: As Taiwan's election approaches next month, it is not only fraught ties with China competing for electors' attention.
articles.title: Whisky and the coal mining 'shack': Taiwan election is not only about China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Explosions in the Red Sea off the coast of Yemen were reported on Tuesday after sightings of unmanned aircraft and missiles in two separate incidents, a British maritime authority said.
articles.title: Explosions reported in Red Sea shipping lane off Yemen coast

articles.author: Rae Wee
articles.description: Asian stocks rose broadly on Wednesday, tracking a rally from Wall Street as investors latched on to the year-end optimism driven by expectations that the Federal Reserve could begin cutting rates as early as next March.
articles.title: Asian stocks rise with year-end cheer; dollar heavy
